What were all those 6,200 Coinbasers doing anyway?

stories.text:
Hi guys. I've been to the WeAreDevelopers 2022 World Congress (day 1 out of 2) and just got back to the hotel.

Let me recap:

- there were approximately 8.000 people - ticket is 500 EUR approx. (+ travel cost for most) - 9.15 was opening but i waited in line till 10.45 - technical difficulties: i received a QR code for checkin but that expired and i had to install the congress app otherwise they wouldn't let me in (i was told) - ironically all of their congress apps and API crashed over and over again, it was bugged out, the feed repeated itself and so forth - it was WAY TOO CROWDED, some workshops were for 20-40 people but again, when there are 8.000 people around, you can imagine - there were 10 food trucks (and they accept cash only) for 8000 people - "WE ARE HIRING" basically every company there -

Some of my other personal impressions: - i attended the "scaling with typescript" talk and: damn it was bad. the code wasn't clean at all and the speaker included some mistakes also; presentation was way too dark with dark text, basically unreadable on a projector. powerpoint 2005 skills be like - all the "partners" and companies there weren't really about tech but "we are hiring" - most of the other talks were about marketing, that's it - there was maybe 1/3 code in the talks i attended and i choose wisely

What do you think? Have you been to the WeAreDevelopers World Congress this year? It was my first time and probably the last.
stories.title: My Personal Recap of WeAreDevelopers 2022 World Congress
